title: Gazebo log filtering taking unreasonable amount of time

content.raw:
We ran a qualification run today and are eager to report it...so we followed the instructions here (#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/qual) and are filtering the log output using the command:

gz log -f ~/.gazebo/log/2018-10-31T090103.904507/gzserver/state.log --filter *.pose/*.pose -z 60 -o ~/.gazebo/log/2018-10-31T090103.904507/gzserver/subt_tunnel_qual_sim_state.log

It took us about 1.5 hours to run the qualification run, and it's already taken over 3.5 hours to filter the log file.  And, the resulting log isn't much smaller than the original (the original is 715 MB, and so far the filtered one is 150 MB).  Can we filter the pose down to a lower frame rate like 5 Hz instead of 60?  Will that help speed up the filter command?  If not, can we just upload the original state.log file?  It seems like we would have had it uploaded by now easily...
content.html:
We ran a qualification run today and are eager to report it...so we followed the instructions here (#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/qual) and are filtering the log output using the command:

gz log -f ~/.gazebo/log/2018-10-31T090103.904507/gzserver/state.log --filter .pose/.pose -z 60 -o ~/.gazebo/log/2018-10-31T090103.904507/gzserver/subt_tunnel_qual_sim_state.log

It took us about 1.5 hours to run the qualification run, and it's already taken over 3.5 hours to filter the log file. And, the resulting log isn't much smaller than the original (the original is 715 MB, and so far the filtered one is 150 MB). Can we filter the pose down to a lower frame rate like 5 Hz instead of 60? Will that help speed up the filter command? If not, can we just upload the original state.log file? It seems like we would have had it uploaded by now easily...
